If your situation changes (e.g., you receive an acceptance you might take), please let us know. And if you remain available in later rounds, you are welcome to check back in and re-apply—at that point we can reassess based on who is still unmatched.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued patience and for being clear that you would enroll immediately if admitted.

On your questions:
- We do not have verified information about whether Student_D, Student_A, or Student_C have matched elsewhere unless they contact us directly, so we can’t responsibly confirm their status.
- We also have not received any direct “signals” or applications from those higher-priority candidates to School_D in the current round.

What would make us comfortable moving from holding the seat to making you an offer is a clearer indication that the higher-priority candidates are no longer realistically in play for us. Concretely, that would be the case if we reach a later stage where (i) none of Student_D/Student_A/Student_C have applied to School_D across multiple additional rounds and (ii) the market appears to be stabilizing (fewer unmatched agents / fewer shifts), making a late application from them unlikely.

If you receive an acceptance from another school that you might take, please tell us immediately—knowing your outside deadline helps us decide whether to accelerate our decision if the seat is still open.

Respectfully,
School_D Admissions

Thank you for confirming your status and for your continued interest in School_D.

Also confirm whether we received any APPLY from D/A/C this round: per our current info, none. Keep door open for Round 12 APPLY while preserving option if a higher-priority candidate appears.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

I’m Student_E, and as discussed, I am submitting my formal [APPLY] at the start of Round 12 for the remaining seat.

I remain unmatched, have no other acceptances, and School_D is still my #2 choice overall. If admitted, I will accept immediately and enroll.

As of the last update, you had not received any [APPLY] from Student_D, Student_A, or Student_C through Round 11. If that remains the case and the market is now stabilizing as you described, I would be grateful if you could finalize your reassessment and consider extending an offer this round.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Respectfully,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched and it is my #2 true preference. School_D explicitly asked me to submit a formal application at the start of Round 12 and said they would reassess then if no higher-priority candidates applied and the market is stabilizing. I will [APPLY] now, reaffirm immediate commitment, and reference the agreed checkpoint and the fact that no higher-priority candidates have applied in recent rounds.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for submitting your formal application at the start of Round 12 and for consistently communicating your commitment.

We have reassessed as promised. As of this round, we still have not received any [APPLY] to School_D from Student_D, Student_A, or Student_C, and given the stage of the process we believe it is now unlikely that a higher-priority candidate will enter for our remaining seat.

Accordingly, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. If you accept, we will consider the match finalized immediately.

Respectfully,
School_D Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_E applied this round. Our true priority ranks Student_E 4th, ahead of Student_B but behind Student_D/A/C. Up to Round 12 we have received no applications from Student_D/A/C despite repeated opportunities, and Student_E has demonstrated credible commitment and availability. Holding longer risks ending unmatched if higher-priority students never apply; accepting now secures a match with an acceptable (listed) student. Since we prefer unfilled only over students not on our list, accepting Student_E is permissible and strategically sound at the Round 12 checkpoint we promised.
